image.altText: A teenage boy with short brown hair wearing glasses and headphones holding an iPad and a sensory soft toy stands smiling.

props.synopsis: For neurodivergent children, going to the emergency department can be overstimulating so the Canberra Hospital has introduced a sensory-friendly room in the children's emergency area to make the experience less overwhelming.

title.children: Max gets overwhelmed in hospital. A sensory-friendly room hopes to help

image.altText: The ACT Supreme Court towards dusk.

props.synopsis: A Canberra man identified by a crooked crowbar and a home CCTV system he installed is convicted of aggravated burglary for breaking into and robbing two cafes in one night.

title.children: Canberra burglar undone by own CCTV system and a crooked crowbar

image.altText: A drone shot of green pastures

props.synopsis: Once used for agricultural research, the development of the CSIRO Ginninderra Experiment Station, a 701-hectare area of land between Belconnen and the Barton Highway, was first floated a decade ago.

title.children: 'Deeply frustrating': Calls to end three-year delay on CSIRO land sale

image.altText: An unidentified child care worker holding hands with a child.

props.synopsis: Former childcare educators are revealing serious incidents at Affinity Education's Canberra centres, including a case of a baby rolling off a change table.

title.children: 'Toxic': Former Affinity childcare staff say baby fell off change table

image.altText: Australian Olympic and world championship bronze medallist Dean Hewitt, practising his delivery of the stone from the hack

props.synopsis: Olympian Dean Hewitt wants to inspire the next generation of curlers in Australia but a lack of purpose-built facilities is stifling high-performance growth in the sport.

title.children: Curling legacy on thin ice as wait continues for purpose-built arena

image.altText: The ACT Supreme Court (good generic). (22 April 2016)

props.synopsis: A 29-year-old man has been sentenced to more than nine years in jail after he admitted to drugging two people and sexually assaulting them.

title.children: Canberra man jailed for drugging, sexually assaulting, filming two people

image.altText: A myrtle rust infection visible as yellow dots on a green branch.

props.synopsis: Myrtle rust is a bright yellow-looking fungus originally from South America, infecting plants in the eucalypt family with sometimes devastating effect.

title.children: 'Quite worrying': Myrtle rust detected at National Museum of Australia

image.altText: Aerial show of flood water across a highway.

props.synopsis: Premier Chris Minns says it may be blue skies across NSW, but residents should still check the Hazards Near Me app and listen to media and emergency broadcasts before changing location. Follow live.

title.children: Don't let blue skies deceive you, premier says — warnings are still in place

image.altText: An SES worker in deep water

props.synopsis: The woman's family claim she has been unfairly painted as "reckless", saying a police officer told her he knew a safe way through the floodwaters and guided her to a road.

title.children: Police launch investigation after death of woman in NSW floodwaters

image.altText: A satellite map showing the epicentre of the quake in the top left corner and cities Newcaste, Sydney and Wollongong.

props.synopsis: A "significant" earthquake and two aftershocks in the early hours rattle homes from the state's north-west to Sydney, with some reporting the ground shook for 30 seconds.

title.children: Beds shake, dogs go 'bonkers' as earthquakes rattle NSW

image.altText: A blurred tree in the foreground, with a sign reading 'Coomalie Community Government Council' on the facade of a green tin shed.

props.synopsis: A regional Northern Territory council is sacked following an investigation revealing what are described as "serious and sustained deficiencies", including that councillors "lacked a full understanding of their responsibilities".

title.children: NT regional council sacked after report reveals 'serious deficiencies'

image.altText: Toby Greene smiles and clenches his fist while walking on the field carrying his daughter

props.synopsis: Carlton and GWS are first up in a pivotal Saturday of AFL footy, while Hawthorn and Brisbane's afternoon MCG clash set to be unmissable. Follow live.

title.children: Greene on fire in special milestone game as Blues and Giants face off

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: A special day for Toby Greene

image.altText: A banner with videos and word 'Fake'

props.synopsis: As a deadly attack shook Kashmir, sparking conflict between India and Pakistan, a war of misinformation was playing out online.

title.children: 'The war of perception is everything': India and Pakistan's online battle

image.altText: A close up photo of Erin Patterson looking over her shoulder wearing glases.

props.synopsis: A web of messages, search histories, and reset phones has emerged in the Erin Patterson trial. But can digital evidence explain what happened at her dinner table?

title.children: Mother, cook, defendant: Trial of Erin Patterson turns to her personal life

image.altText: A single dingo lies down on sand

props.synopsis: Rangers say a dingo stabbed with a pocketknife by a bystander to halt its attack on a nine-year-old boy has been euthanased.

title.children: Dingo euthanased after it was stabbed to release child

image.altText: A young girl in an orange shirt smiling

props.synopsis: Police have expanded their search for missing Bundaberg teenager Pheobe Bishop, appealing for information on movement in the Good Night Scrub National Park.

title.children: What we know about the disappearance of 17yo Pheobe Bishop

image.altText: A man in a black suit sits behind a microphone and piano

props.synopsis: Billy Joel reveals he has normal pressure hydrocephalus, which affects concentrating, memory and movement.

title.children: Billy Joel reveals brain disorder and cancels tour

image.altText: Dead sea life under the water, grey clouds above the water

props.synopsis: A mysterious brown foam appeared on a beach south of Adelaide. It was just the beginning of a toxic algal bloom that has now grown to thousands of square kilometres in size, killing precious sea life in its wake.

title.children: 'This could be the beginning of the end': Toxic algal bloom a sign of a changing climate

image.altText: Models on a runway.

props.synopsis: According to the latest National Waste Report, the average Australian throws out about 11 kilograms of clothing each year. But what if some of that could be composted?

title.children: Paper clothes are turning heads and they're more durable than you think

image.altText: a Man looks at the camera as he walks through a heavy industrial area

props.synopsis: I suspect the world is divided into two groups: those who worship Star Wars and can spend hours arguing over the complexities of far-flung corners of its universe; and those who swipe left and close the app immediately when they see someone has mentioned George Lucas's creation as one of their great loves.

title.children: Star Wars's fascist dystopia has never felt closer

image.altText: Photo of a man crouching down on a field.

props.synopsis: Australian farm productivity is in decline, prompting calls for policy reform as experts warn high yields are masking deeper issues.

title.children: The quiet Australian farming crisis you may not have heard about

image.altText: A woman with long light brown hair in a white top with floral pattern stares at the camera.

props.synopsis: A company that manages at least 140 disability homes in Queensland is being accused of making misleading claims to property investors.

title.children: Retiree 'forced back to work' after investing in disability accommodation

image.altText: A damaged car and the French travellers

props.synopsis: Just hours into their WA road trip Melina Gitton and Florian Crepinior had a disastrous run in with a kangaroo. But locals in Nannup were quick to help them out.

title.children: Country hospitality helps stranded French travellers get back on the road

image.altText: Solar photovoltaic panels on a house roof

props.synopsis: The NSW government has launched a new approach to renewable energy in the Illawarra, pitching the region as the state's first "urban renewable energy zone".

title.children: NSW has its first 'urban renewable energy zone'. So, how does it work?

image.altText: Stitch acts like a dog, his tongue hanging out and grinning.

props.synopsis: The new Lilo & Stitch's formula is simple: remove everything that could possibly offend anyone, replace the personalised hand-drawn animation with CGI, add in a little slapstick and a Bruno Mars song, and you've got yourself a hit.

title.children: Disney once again serves up a sanitised and unnecessary live-action remake

image.altText: A woman scoops out a portion of cheeseburger rice bake from the baking tray to an awaiting bowl. A fun, delicious weeknight m

props.synopsis: It might sound unconventional, but the combo of rice, mince and cheese is anything but unusual across the world and the flavours are comforting and nostalgic.

title.children: This cheesy rice bake is an effortless way to make a burger bowl

image.altText: A man with tattoos and glasses smiles

props.synopsis: Dave Shapiro, who was the US talent representative for a slew of Australian musicians including Parkway Drive and Amity Affliction, has died in a San Diego plane crash.

title.children: US music executive Dave Shapiro killed in plane crash

image.altText: An older gentlemen with white hair wearing a blue polo shirt standing in front of a grey model ship

props.synopsis: Ernie Pitts first began building model ships in an attempt to reduce his drinking. Almost 60 years later, his incredible built-from-scratch models are on show in a museum.

title.children: Pastime for avoiding the pub becomes life-long shipbuilding obsession

image.altText: Two hands adjusting some jeans as a sewing machine gets to work

props.synopsis: The national minimum wage in Australia is $24.10 and yet Ethical Clothing Australia says there are outworkers locally earning less than half of that to make the clothes you're wearing.

title.children: Exploited workers are making clothes for as little as $10 an hour

image.altText: A police man smiling surrounded by dry bushland.

props.synopsis: The coroner's court has heard Constable Michael Deutrom continued to uphold the force's mantra — "service above self" — after 20 years in uniform, until he reached a "tipping point".

title.children: 'Service above self': NT Police officer's struggle laid bare in court

image.altText: Forensic experts work at Hamburg's main train station.

props.synopsis: German police have arrested a woman after a stabbing attack at the busy central train station in the German city of Hamburg that left multiple people injured, some of them in life-threatening condition.

title.children: Woman arrested after mass stabbing attack at Hamburg train station

image.altText: harvard

props.synopsis: The move comes hours after the Ivy League school launched legal action against the US government over its attempts to stop the enrolment of students from overseas.

title.children: Judge blocks Trump administration's Harvard University enrolment ban

image.altText: Ange Postecoglou holds a trophy

props.synopsis: In 2008, Ange Postecoglou was a Fox Sports pundit who felt unemployable. Now he's the first Australian football manager to win a major European club trophy.

title.children: Ange Postecoglou went from unemployable to a king of Europe
